entry.title: Bitcoin Outflows Show Huge Spike, Whales Going On Shopping Spree?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows exchanges have observed a vast Bitcoin outflow recently, a sign that whales may be going on a buying spree of the asset.
Bitcoin Exchange Netflows Have Been Negative In Recent Days
An analyst in a CryptoQuant post pointed out that around 10,000 BTC flowed out of exchanges yesterday. The relevant indicator here is the “all exchanges netflow,” which measures the net amount of Bitcoin entering or exiting the wallets of all centralized exchanges. The metric’s value is calculated by dividing the inflows and outflows.
When the indicator records a positive value, the inflows are more significant than the outflows, and a net amount of BTC is moving into exchanges. If these deposits are heading towards spot exchanges, BTC could feel a bearish impact as investors usually us…

entry.title: Bitcoin loses 21k support, as contagion from Silvergate enters banks, financials sector
Integrating Cryptocurrencies in E-Commerce: Opportunities and Risks in 2023
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum have made headlines in recent years due to their dramatic price fluctuations and potential to disrupt traditional financial systems.

The use of cryptocurrencies in e-commerce, on the other hand, is a relatively new and unexplored concept. In this article, we'll look at the benefits and drawbacks of incorporating cryptocurrencies into e-commerce.

Cryptocurrency Integration Possibilities in E-Commerce

Global Reach

One of the most significant advantages of cryptocurrencies is their ability to facilitate quick and secure global transactions. Cryptocurrencies, unlike traditional payment methods, are not subject to exchange rates or international transaction fees, making them an appealing option for b…

entry.title: Expert Warns of Possible Deflationary Depression as Money Supply Contracts: ‘Pay Attention to QT and the Money Supply’
entry.summary:
During the Covid-19 pandemic, central banks such as the U.S. Federal Reserve loosened fiscal and monetary policy. Now, these same financial institutions are seemingly engaging in quantitative tightening (QT) practices. According to Nick Gerli, CEO and founder of Reventure Consulting, “the money supply is officially contracting.” This has only happened four times in the last 150 years. Gerli warns that every time it occurs, a depression takes place with double-digit unemployment rates.
The Contraction of Money Supply and its Impact on the Economy
Several market analysts and economists are uncertain about the future of the economy, while many believe things will soon get worse due to significant inflation and failures in central planning. When the Covid-19 pandemic hit, the U.S. governme…

entry.title: Gate Group Expands Payment Offerings With New Visa Debit Card Rollout In Europe
entry.summary:
Gate Group, the company behind the popular exchange Gate.io, plans to launch a European crypto debit card to expand its reach to European countries. Users can seamlessly convert and spend their crypto assets with the card in everyday purchases.
One of the factors that push adoption in the crypto space is continuous developments. As each firm operating in the sector expands its reach to different countries, more users will join the industry, increasing knowledge and eventual adoption.
Gate.io Debit Card To Push Adoption
Gate Group plans to launch the card with the support of its Lithuania-based company Gate Global UAB. According to a Twitter post, the card will enable users to complete crypto-to-fiat conversions for online and in-store purchases.
It will make the process faster…

entry.title: Regulator Warns Crypto Investors Against “Proof Of Reserve” Reports, Says It Can’t Be Trusted
entry.summary:
While the intervention of regulators in the crypto industry could sometime seem unnecessary or frightening, it is worth noting that not all regulators are villains, some are just keen on consumer protection.
On Wednesday, the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB), an industry-funded watchdog working under the authority of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) published an advisory report addressing the so-called “Proof of Reserve” crypto firms reveals to customers to prove solvency.
PCAOB Addresses “Proof Of Reserve” Reports
Proof of Reserve, also known as PoR, is a type of report industry firms such as crypto exchanges and stablecoin issuers have been using over the past months since the FTX crash, to tout their protection against bank runs.
While crypto firms…

entry.title: Elizabeth Warren Blames ‘Crypto Risk’ for Silvergate Bank’s Liquidation, Critics Dismiss Senator’s Claims as ‘Terribly Misinformed’
entry.summary:
After Silvergate Bank announced its voluntary liquidation, U.S. senator Elizabeth Warren is attributing the financial institution’s downfall to “crypto risk.” According to Warren, she had previously warned about Silvergate. However, some critics are dismissing Warren’s opinion as “terribly misinformed” and claim that she is “tossing out egregious accusations.”
Crypto Proponents Offer Different Perspectives on Silvergate Bank’s Downfall After Elizabeth Warren Blasts So-Called ‘Crypto Risk’
Hours after Silvergate Bank announced its liquidation, U.S. senator Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) tweeted about the financial institution’s demise. Warren once again referred to cryptocurrencies as risky and expressed disappointment about Silvergate’s failure, which she deemed “predictable.”
On March 9, U…

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: Big Brands Must Be 'as Crypto-Native as Possible' Entering NFT Space: Gmoney
entry.summary: Gmoney's experience in the NFT space has been one of learning and iterating, something that some "legacy" brands have a hard time adopting.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director: Filmmakers Need New NFT Funding Models, 'The Space Moves So Rapidly'
entry.summary: Director Miguel Faus "wouldn't recommend" that other filmmakers duplicate his NFT fundraising approach exactly, as the space has already evolved.

entry.summary: The Gary Vee-backed startup continues its shift beyond sports-themed collectibles.

entry.title: Blockasset Athlete NFTs Expand Beyond Solana to Chiliz Sports Platform
entry.summary: More than 40 athletes offer NFTs via Blockasset, including soccer star Wayne Rooney, the NHL's Alex Ovechkin, and the UFC's Jorge Masvidal.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Yuga Twelvefold Bitcoin NFT Auction Raises $16.5 Million
entry.summary: The company’s collection of 300 generative art pieces garnered over 3,000 bids in 24 hours.

entry.title: What Is a Sovereign Rollup? Rollkit Pitches Second Layer for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Whether or not it's novel, it's another Bitcoin tool inspired by Ordinals.

entry.title: Hermès Seeks Stronger Block of MetaBirkins NFT Sales
entry.summary: After a legal victory against the NFT collection for trademark infringement, Hermès is asking a judge to force the collection offline permanently.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."

entry.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity
entry.summary: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement—until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.
